alert.note: Alert for Saginaw; Shiawassee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 9:55PM EST until February 23 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Shiawassee River At Owosso affecting Saginaw and Shiawassee Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Shiawassee River At Owosso. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning until Wednesday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 6.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to flood stage and crest at 7.0 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Impact...Minor flooding is likely along portions of the river. Any moving ice chunks in the river can do damage or cause ice jams which could result in rapid fluctuations of river level. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
